siteMetadata.name: Nezar Boujida
siteMetadata.title: Nezar Boujida | Data Scientist
siteMetadata.about:
I'm Nezar, a long-distance runner with a passion for traveling, discovery, and problem-solving. I’m studying Applied Mathematics and Computer Science at Sorbonne University, where I dive into data science, explore complex datasets, and uncover patterns.

I've gained experience as a Data Scientist intern at Datategy and Hiflow, and now, I'm diving into the technical side as a Data Engineer intern at Launchmetrics. I enjoy sharing my journey through projects and discoveries, always eager to learn, grow.

projects.name: Recommender System for Optimized Driver Selection in Vehicle Transfer Services
projects.description: Developed a system to rank and select drivers efficiently, doubling engagement and reducing operational costs by up to 20%, enabling scalable growth in vehicle transfer operations.

projects.name: Traffic Modeling and Forecasting Using Sensor Data in Paris
projects.description: Analyzed traffic patterns from 3,500 sensors in Paris to identify congestion trends and relationships between vehicle flow and road occupancy, with plans to build forecasting models and account for geographical dependencies.

projects.name: Parallelized Simulation of Heat Dissipation in AMD EPYC 'Rome' CPU Heatsink
projects.description: Conducted a parallelized numerical simulation of heatsink dynamics in AMD EPYC CPUs, leveraging fine mesh grids to improve thermal modeling accuracy while reducing computation time.

projects.name: Optimizing FFT Performance through Parallelization and Vectorization
projects.description: Accelerated FFT processing of white noise by leveraging OpenMP parallelization and AVX2 vectorization, significantly improving execution speed.

projects.name: Ride-Hailing Trends in New York City: Uber, Lyft, and Via Operations Analysis
projects.description: Analyzed fare pricing, demand patterns, and borough-specific dynamics of Uber, Lyft, and Via in NYC using trip data from January to May 2021, uncovering insights into the competitive landscape and operational challenges.

skills.name: Data Analytics, Machine Learning & Tools
skills.description: Data Visualization / Analysis, Plotly, Pandas, Numpy, scikit-learn, seaborn, Folium, Machine Learning, Databricks, Databricks Unity Catalog, Apache Spark, PySpark, PostgreSQL, MySQL

skills.name: Programming & Tools
skills.description: Python, R, C, C++, SQL, Poetry, Python Wheel

skills.name: Soft Skills
skills.description: Presentation, Planning, Organized, Creative Problem-Solving, Teamwork,  Adaptability, Research and Analysis, Critical Thinking, Time Management, Creative Problem Solving
